headline: Tesla shareholder meeting preview: 3 things to watch
summary: Tesla's (TSLA) shareholder meeting is scheduled for Thursday, Nov. 6, where shareholders will vote on several items, including Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed pay package, valued at up to $1 trillion. Yahoo Finance Auto Reporter Pras Subramanian joins Market Domination Overtime with Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal to discuss the upcoming meeting and take a look at Tesla's declining sales numbers in Europe. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: A Dave Ramsey Caller Is Losing His High-Paying Job In December, Yet He's In A Position Most People Dream Of. 'This Is Just An Inconvenience'

headline: Samsung SDI in talks with Tesla to supply energy storage batteries, shares soar
summary: South Korea's Samsung SDI said on Tuesday it is in talks to supply energy storage batteries to Tesla, in an order that Korean media said could be worth more than 3 trillion won ($2.11 billion).  Samsung SDI shares soared more than 8% on the news.  A deal would mark the latest push by Tesla to reduce reliance on China for key parts, fueled by tariffs and geopolitical tensions.

content.summary: South Korea's Samsung SDI said on Tuesday it is in talks to supply energy storage batteries to Tesla, in an order that Korean media said could be worth more than 3 trillion won ($2.11 billion).  Samsung SDI shares soared more than 8% on the news.  A deal would mark the latest push by Tesla to reduce reliance on China for key parts, fueled by tariffs and geopolitical tensions.

headline: Tesla, IBD Stock Of The Day, Eyes Breakout Ahead Of This Big Event
summary: Tesla is Monday's IBD Stock Of The Day, as shares traded right around a buy point ahead of the annual shareholder meeting later in the week, with CEO Elon Musk's pay deal in focus.  Tesla stock jumped 2.6% to about 468.37 in Monday's stock market after advancing 5.3% to 456.56 last week.  On Monday Tesla stock moved as high as 474.07, as the stock eyes a breakout from a traditional flat base buy point of 470.75, according to a weekly MarketSurge chart.

On Monday Tesla stock moved as high as 474.07, as the stock eyes a breakout from a traditional flat base buy point of 470.75, according to a weekly MarketSurge chart.

headline: Tesla Breaks Out From Buy Point Ahead Of 'One Of The Most Important Events' For EV Giant
summary: Tesla stock briefly broke out above a buy point on Monday ahead of the annual shareholder meeting later in the week, with CEO Elon Musk's pay deal in focus.  TSLA hit 474.07 intraday before finishing Monday's stock market up 2.6% to 468.45.  Tesla stock advanced 5.3% to 456.56 last week.

headline: Wedbush’s Ives sees ’bright green light’ for Musk’s $1 trillion Tesla pay plan
summary: Investing.com -- Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) is heading into one of the most consequential shareholder meetings in its history this Thursday, with all eyes on a proposed multibillion-dollar pay package for CEO Elon Musk. According to Wedbush’s Dan Ives, investors will likely deliver “a bright green light.” In a note from Monday, Ives said he expects shareholders to overwhelmingly approve Musk’s compensation plan, which could ultimately be worth around $1 trillion if all performance targets are met.

headline: Tesla sales resume fall in European markets in October
summary:
STORY: Tesla sales plunged in October in a number of European countries.

It's the latest sign the U.S. electric vehicle maker's struggles in Europe continue.

Local industry data showed Monday (November 3) the automaker's new car registrations dropped 89% in Sweden.

They were also down 86% in Denmark, and just under a half in the Netherlands.

The drop-off comes despite industry-wide sales of fully-electric and plug-in hybrid models rising 119%.

Tesla's sales have fallen in Europe this year partly due to a small, ageing line-up of models.

It also faces rising competition from local competitors and Chinese brands.

In Denmark, for instance, Tesla was outsold by several Chinese EV companies, including BYD and Xpeng.

The company has also faced a backlash from some European consumers against CEO Elon Musk

He helped fund Donald Trump's U.S. presidential election victory last year and has supported European far-right parties.

The drop-off comes despite industry-wide sales of fully-electric and plug-in hybrid models rising 119%.

Tesla's sales have fallen in Europe this year partly due to a small, ageing line-up of models.

It also faces rising competition from local competitors and Chinese brands.

In Denmark, for instance, Tesla was outsold by several Chinese EV companies, including BYD and Xpeng.

The company has also faced a backlash from some European consumers against CEO Elon Musk

He helped fund Donald Trump's U.S. presidential election victory last year and has supported European far-right parties.

headline: MacKenzie Scott Makes Large Donations to HBCU, Bucking National Trend
summary: Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott, the ex-wife of Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) founder Jeff Bezos, has donated $63 million to Morgan State University. It's Scott's second donation to the Baltimore-based university, bringing her total to $103 million in the last five years. W

headline: Google, Tesla, Samsung: Trending stocks
summary: Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) is reportedly issuing billions of euros in bond to fund its AI and cloud expansion. It's a crucial week for Tesla, (TSLA) which prepares to vote a trillion-dollar pay package for Elon Musk as its sales continue to nosedive in Europe - registrations are down 89% in Sweden in October. After its deal with Nvidia (NVDA), Samsung (005930.KS) is set to provide Tesla with $2 billion worth of ESS batteries, according to a South Korean newspaper. And Xiaomi (1810.HK) might be in trouble because of its EV's, but shares are rising after Xi Jinping gave Xiaomi smartphones to South Korea's president - and even cracked a joke about spying using Chinese devices. Plus, the mysterious stock (HKD) that shot up 74%. For more live coverage of the markets, watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and visit Yahoo Finance.

headline: Tesla Owner Complaints Rise in US Door-Handle Defect Probe
summary: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration cited the additional complaints in an Oct. 27 letter to Tesla about the investigation the agency initiated in mid-September.  The letter provides a glimpse into how NHTSA is proceeding with an investigation launched days after Bloomberg News uncovered a series of incidents in which people were injured or died after they were unable to open the doors of Teslas following battery-power losses or crashes.  Tesla’s longtime design chief later told Bloomberg that the company was working on changes to its door handles.

content.title: Tesla Owner Complaints Rise in US Door-Handle Defect Probe
content.summary: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration cited the additional complaints in an Oct. 27 letter to Tesla about the investigation the agency initiated in mid-September.  The letter provides a glimpse into how NHTSA is proceeding with an investigation launched days after Bloomberg News uncovered a series of incidents in which people were injured or died after they were unable to open the doors of Teslas following battery-power losses or crashes.  Tesla’s longtime design chief later told Bloomberg that the company was working on changes to its door handles.

headline: This Week In Electric Vehicles - UK Solar E-Bikes Pedal Toward Sustainable Growth
summary: The U.K. Solar E-Bike Market is experiencing robust growth propelled by the demand for sustainable transportation solutions, government incentives, and technological advancements in solar energy and battery systems. Solar-powered e-bikes are gaining popularity for urban commuting and recreational use, providing eco-friendly alternatives to conventional transportation. Despite challenges such as high initial costs, the integration of smart features and improved infrastructure are contributing...

Solar-powered e-bikes are gaining popularity for urban commuting and recreational use, providing eco-friendly alternatives to conventional transportation. Despite challenges such as high initial costs, the integration of smart features and improved infrastructure are contributing...

headline: Tesla to buy $2 billion of ESS batteries from Samsung SDI over 3 years, newspaper says
summary: SEOUL (Reuters) -South Korea's Samsung SDI has reached an agreement with Tesla (TSLA) to supply more than 3 trillion won ($2.11 billion) worth of ESS (Energy Storage System) batteries to Tesla over three years, the Korea Economic Daily reported on Monday.

content.title: Tesla to buy $2 billion of ESS batteries from Samsung SDI over 3 years, newspaper says
content.summary: SEOUL (Reuters) -South Korea's Samsung SDI has reached an agreement with Tesla (TSLA) to supply more than 3 trillion won ($2.11 billion) worth of ESS (Energy Storage System) batteries to Tesla over three years, the Korea Economic Daily reported on Monday.
